alert.note: Alert for Kit Carson County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 16 at 5:15PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Kit Carson County through 545 PM MDT... At 514 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 13 miles southwest of Bonny Reservoir, moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Burlington. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Colorado between mile markers 434 and 445. Highway 385 between mile markers 181 and 205, and near mile marker 211. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
